summary: This bill, the United States-Israel PTSD Collaborative Research Act, directs the Secretary of Defense to establish a grant program for collaborative research on post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) between the United States and Israel. The bill highlights the prevalence of PTSD among veterans and the general population in both countries and aims to foster cooperation between American and Israeli institutions to improve research, diagnosis, and treatment of PTSD. Grants will be awarded to eligible U.S. academic and nonprofit entities conducting joint research projects with Israeli partners. The Secretary of Defense will report to Congress on the use and success of the grants.
